poem:
Title: "Diplomacy's Echo"

Justice dances in spaces wide,
between opined west and east aside.
Chatter of Capitol whispers slight,
In day's noon, through shrouded night.
Bernie's voice, a rebel cry,
In Senate hall, questions why.
Khan's quest, a woven narrative,
Ink-dipped in worth, declarative.
Two states in discourse dream,
Or one alone in sorrow's theme?
